questions.question: I ................... a discussion with my boss in the morning.
questions.description: In the morning usually refers to past time hence, the simple past is preferred with it.

questions.question: They ...................... to our proposal.
questions.description: The present perfect is commonly used to announce news.

questions.question: Nobody knows how he .................... from the prison.
When I talked to her I realized that she ....................... depressed
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we usually use past tenses in the subordinate clauses as well.

questions.question: I ..................... to him since our last meeting.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to talk about time up to now.

questions.question: I .................... out every day.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about habits, routines etc.

questions.question: Neither the manager nor his secretary ...................... present in the office.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with neither/nor, the verb is singular.

questions.question: The quality of life in urban areas ......................... deteriorating.
questions.description: Here the subject is the singular noun quality.

questions.question: Even the mightiest .................... prey to death.
questions.description: The mightiest is a plural expression.
